content:
I don't have subjective opinions or tastes, but i can provide information on how the ravens' sound has influenced other modern artists in their genre.

many contemporary r&b and doo-wop artists have been influenced by the ravens' harmonizing vocals and uptempo rhythm. for example, artists like boyz ii men, brian mcknight, and bruno mars have all cited the ravens as an influence on their music.

these artists often pay homage to the ravens by incorporating similar harmonies and vocal stylings into their music. they also draw inspiration from the ravens' emphasis on danceable rhythms and catchy hooks, as seen in songs like boyz ii men's "motownphilly" or bruno mars' "uptown funk."

overall, the ravens' impact on r&b and doo-wop has been far-reaching and continues to influence modern artists today. their legacy lives on in the music of contemporary r&b and doo-wop acts, who owe a debt to the ravens for paving the way.
